sentences.en: A rat can gnaw a hole through wood.
But you promised to help us, you rat!
sentences.cn: 可是你答应过要帮我的忙, 你这言而无信的小人!

sentences.en: Captain Hardnose certainly ran that rat over the hill.
sentences.cn: 哈得诺思上尉当然要求那个告密者离职了.

sentences.en: He was wet all over like a drowned rat.
sentences.cn: 他浑身湿得像只落汤鸡.

sentences.en: I glimpsed a rat running past.
sentences.cn: 我看到一只老鼠跑过去了.

sentences.en: If I don't send a picture, he will smell a rat.
sentences.cn: 如果我不寄出照片，他将有所察觉。

sentences.en: men will literally choose death over ratting out another prisoner.
sentences.cn: 男人们确实宁肯死掉也不愿告发其他囚犯。

sentences.en: Paul got caught up in the rat race and was never at home.
sentences.cn: 保罗被卷入激烈的竞争中,都没在家呆过.

sentences.en: Rat - fleas communicate a disease to man.
sentences.cn: 鼠蚤会把疾病传染给人.

sentences.en: Suddenly there came a rat - a - tat on the door.
sentences.cn: 突然传来了一阵梆梆的敲门声.

sentences.en: The brown rat has prominent ears and a long scaly tail.
sentences.cn: 那只棕鼠两只耳朵向前支着，一条长尾巴布满鳞片。

sentences.en: The dog is worrying the rat.
The dog nosed out a rat.
sentences.cn: 那只狗闻到一只老鼠的气味.

sentences.en: The lab assistant injected the rat with the new drug.
sentences.cn: 实验室助手给老鼠注射了那种新药.

sentences.en: They longed to escape from the rat race and move to the countryside.
sentences.cn: 他们渴望能够摆脱无情的竞争,搬到乡下去.

sentences.en: They were accused of encouraging children to rat on their parents.
sentences.cn: 他们被指控唆使儿童告发自己的父母。

sentences.en: This was demonstrated in a laboratory experiment with rats.
sentences.cn: 这点通过在实验室中用老鼠做试验得到证明。

phrases.tran_cn: 逛商厦迷；爱逛商店的年轻人
不可靠的人，有敛癖的人
n. [俚]激烈竞争（商业上）；无意义的竞争；[电]环形导波管
感到不妙；感到有可疑之处
河鼠；（美）麝香鼠（等于muskrat）；[俚]岸滨小偷

trans.tran_cn: 大老鼠，似鼠动物，<非正式>鼠辈，卑鄙小人
trans.tran_en: an animal that looks like a large mouse with a long tail
if someone rats on you, they tell someone in authority about something wrong that you have done
